verses.verse: A voice came from above the firmament that was over their heads; whenever they stood, they let down their wings.

(Ezek. 10:1) And above the firmament over their heads was the likeness of a throne, (Ex. 24:10, 16; Ezek. 8:4; 11:22, 23; 43:4, 5) in appearance like a sapphire stone; on the likeness of the throne was a likeness with the appearance of a man high above (Ezek. 8:2) it.

Also from the appearance of His waist and upward (Ezek. 8:2) I saw, as it were, the color of amber with the appearance of fire all around within it; and from the appearance of His waist and downward I saw, as it were, the appearance of fire with brightness all around.

((Gen. 9:13); Rev. 4:3; 10:1) Like the appearance of a rainbow in a cloud on a rainy day, so was the appearance of the brightness all around it. (Ezek. 3:23; 8:4) This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the LORD. So when I saw it, (Gen. 17:3; Ezek. 3:23; Dan. 8:17; Acts 9:4; Rev. 1:17) I fell on my face, and I heard a voice of One speaking.
And He said to me, “Son of man, (Dan. 10:11; Acts 9:6) stand on your feet, and I will speak to you.”
Then (Ezek. 3:24; Dan. 8:18) the Spirit entered me when He spoke to me, and set me on my feet; and I heard Him who spoke to me.

And He said to me: “Son of man, I am sending you to the children of Israel, to a rebellious nation that has (Ezek. 5:6; 20:8, 13, 18) rebelled against Me; (1 Sam. 8:7, 8; Jer. 3:25; Ezek. 20:18, 21, 30) they and their fathers have transgressed against Me to this very day.
(Ps. 95:8; Is. 48:4; Jer. 5:3; 6:15; Ezek. 3:7) For they are impudent and stubborn children. I am sending you to them, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD.’

(Is. 6:9, 10; Ezek. 3:11, 26, 27; (Matt. 10:12-15; Acts 13:46)) As for them, whether they hear or whether they refuse—for they are a (Ezek. 3:26) rebellious house—yet they (Ezek. 33:33; (Luke 10:10, 11; John 15:22)) will know that a prophet has been among them.

“And you, son of man, (Is. 51:12; Jer. 1:8, 17; Ezek. 3:9; Luke 12:4) do not be afraid of them nor be afraid of their words, though ((2 Sam. 23:6, 7; Is. 9:18); Jer. 6:28; Ezek. 28:24; Mic. 7:4) briers and thorns are with you and you dwell among scorpions; (Ezek. 3:9; (1 Pet. 3:14)) do not be afraid of their words or dismayed by their looks, (Ezek. 3:9, 26, 27) though they are a rebellious house.
(Jer. 1:7, 17; (Ezek. 3:10, 17)) You shall speak My words to them, whether they hear or whether they refuse, for they are rebellious.
But you, son of man, hear what I say to you. Do not be rebellious like that rebellious house; open your mouth and (Ezek. 3:1-3; Rev. 10:9) eat what I give you.”
Now when I looked, there was (Jer. 1:9; (Ezek. 8:3)) a hand stretched out to me; and behold, (Jer. 36:2; Ezek. 3:1; Rev. 5:1-5; 10:8-11) a scroll of a book was in it.
Then He spread it before me; and there was writing on the inside and on the outside, and written on it were lamentations and mourning and woe.
Moreover He said to me, “Son of man, eat what you find; (Ezek. 2:8, 9) eat this scroll, and go, speak to the house of Israel.”
So I opened my mouth, and He caused me to eat that scroll.

And He said to me, “Son of man, feed your belly, and fill your stomach with this scroll that I give you.” So I (Jer. 15:16; Rev. 10:9) ate, and it was in my mouth (Ps. 19:10; 119:103) like honey in sweetness.
Then He said to me: “Son of man, go to the house of Israel and speak with My words to them.
For you are not sent to a people of unfamiliar speech and of hard language, but to the house of Israel,
not to many people of unfamiliar speech and of hard language, whose words you cannot understand. Surely, (Jon. 3:5-10; Matt. 11:21) had I sent you to them, they would have listened to you.
But the house of Israel will not listen to you, (John 15:20, 21) because they will not listen to Me; (Ezek. 2:4) for all the house of Israel are impudent and hard-hearted.
Behold, I have made your face strong against their faces, and your forehead strong against their foreheads.

(Is. 50:7; Jer. 1:18; Mic. 3:8) Like adamant stone, harder than flint, I have made your forehead; (Jer. 1:8, 17; Ezek. 2:6) do not be afraid of them, nor be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.”
Moreover He said to me: “Son of man, receive into your heart all My words that I speak to you, and hear with your ears.
And go, get to the captives, to the children of your people, and speak to them and tell them, (Ezek. 2:5, 7) ‘Thus says the Lord GOD,’ whether they hear, or whether they refuse.”
Then (1 Kin. 18:12; Ezek. 8:3; Acts 8:39) the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me a great thunderous voice: “Blessed is the (Ezek. 1:28; 8:4) glory of the LORD from His place!”
I also heard the (Ezek. 1:24; 10:5) noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another, and the noise of the wheels beside them, and a great thunderous noise.
